structure.unit: Jurisdiction And Emblems Of The Commonwealth, The General Court, Statutes And Public Documents

law.catch_line: Petition By Town For Authority To Borrow Outside Statutory Debt Limit
law.text: [ Text of section effective until January 1, 2013. For text effective January 1, 2013, see below.] Any petition to the general court, with the accompanying bill, of any town for authority to borrow money outside the statutory limit of indebtedness shall be transmitted by the committee of the general court to which the same may be referred to the director of accounts for information as to the financial condition of the town, and he shall as soon as possible make a report thereon to said committee. Chapter 3: Report on financial condition of town petitioning to borrow outside statutory debt limit [ Text of section as amended by 2012, 165, Sec. 1 effective January 1, 2013. See 2012, 165, Sec. 137. For text effective until January 1, 2013, see above.] When evaluating a petition by a city or town to borrow money in excess of the statutory limit of indebtedness under section 10 of chapter 44, the legislative committee to which that petition may be referred shall solicit a report on the financial condition of the city or town from the division of local services, which shall deliver the report as soon as possible.
